abstracts.cdata!:
The Zambia National Response to HIV/AIDS
            Project (ZANARA) aims to reduce the spread of HIV/AIDS, to
            mitigate the socio-economic impact of the disease, and to
            increase access to care and support for people infected or
            affected by the HIV/AIDS epidemic in Zambia. The project is
            selective in the support it provides and focuses on the
            financing of high priority interventions for which
            significant funding gaps exist. The overall project is based
            on a new approach for addressing HIV/AIDS by supporting and
            strengthening community-based responses to the epidemic.
            There are four components to the project: 1) support for
            community response to HIV/AIDS (CRAIDS), through financing
            activities by community based organizations 2) support to
            the National AIDS Council and Secretariat, 3) support to the
            line ministries, in order to mainstream HIV/AIDS related
            activities into the work programs of all line ministries,
            and finance the Ministry of Health for support
            implementation activities, and 4) program administration.
